discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When you move a managed FortiGate device from one ADOM to another in FortiManager, the configuration is not transferred automatically. Specifically:

 Policy Packages: Policy packages associated with the FortiGate in the old ADOM are not automatically moved or imported into the new ADOM. You need to manually re-create or import them in the new ADOM.
 Shared Device Settings: These settings are not automatically installed in the new ADOM.
 Unused Objects: Unused objects from the previous ADOM are not moved automatically.

This behavior ensures that administrators can manage and review configurations explicitly when transitioning devices between ADOMs to avoid unintended configuration mismatches or conflicts.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct, study guide page 67

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

B it's correct
From study Guide : When you move devices from one ADOM to another ADOM, shared policy packages and objects do not move to the new ADOM. You will need to import policy packages from managed devices

B is correct

choices.A: The shared device settings will be installed automatically.
choices.C: Any unused objects from a previous ADOM are moved to the new ADOM automatically.
choices.D: Policy packages will be imported into the new ADOM automatically.
choices.B: The shared policy package will not be moved to the new ADOM automatically.

questions.question_text:
You are moving managed FortiGate devices from one ADOM to a new ADOM.
Which statement correctly describes the expected result?
What does a policy package status of Never Installed indicate?

choices.B: The policy configuration has been changed on a managed device and changes have not yet been imported into FortiManager.
choices.C: The policy package was never imported after a device was registered on FortiManager.
choices.A: FortiManager is unable to determine the policy package status.
choices.D: The policy configuration has been changed on FortiManager and changes have not yet been installed on the managed device.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct
True C

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. No action is required because of VRRP activated on the HA configuration. The Failover will occur automatically once the monitored interface is lost.

FMG 7.4 Administrator Study Guide
C because of VRRP

choices.C: The FortiManager HA failover is transparent to administrators and does not require any additional action.
choices.D: Reconfigure the primary device to remove the peer IP address of the failed device from its configuration.
choices.B: Reboot the current primary device to force a secondary device to become the new primary.
choices.A: Manually promote one of the working secondary devices to the primary role, and reboot the old primary device to remove the peer IP address of the failed device.

choices.D: Policies not imported are deleted on the managed FortiGate during the installation.
choices.A: Policies not imported prompt a confirmation before being deleted.
choices.B: Policies not imported are marked as modified for future import attempts.
choices.C: Policies not imported remain untouched on the managed FortiGate.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct Answer: D.


The wizard performs a policy search to find all policies in preparation for import into the FortiManager database. You may choose to import all firewall policies, or select specific policies to import. If you choose to import only specific policies into the policy package and later install policy changes, the policies that were not imported will be deleted locally on FortiGate. This is because FortiManager does not have those policies in the policy package. - FortiManager 7.4 Administrator Study Guide - Page No:190

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
D is correct

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.
Policies not imported remain untouched on md. But if you Re-Install the policy package on the md, the non imported policies will all be deleted.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An administrator is importing a new device into FortiManager and has selected the options shown in the exhibit.
What will happen if the administrator makes changes and then installs the modified policy package on this managed FortiGate?

choices.A: FortiManager ignored the firewall service category General but created a new service category in its database.
choices.C: FortiManager ignored the firewall service category General and did not update its database with the value.
choices.B: FortiManager ignored the firewall service category General and deleted the duplicate value in its database.
choices.D: FortiManager ignored the firewall service category General and updated the FortiGate duplicate value in the FortiGate database.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
C is correct
